jade.core.behaviours
Class ParallelPriorityBehaviour

java.lang.Object
  jade.core.behaviours.Behaviour
      jade.core.behaviours.CompositeBehaviour
          jade.core.behaviours.ParallelPriorityBehaviour
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class ParallelPriorityBehaviour
extends jade.core.behaviours.CompositeBehaviour

Composite behaviour with priority based children scheduling. It is a CompositeBehaviour that executes its children behaviours using their priorities, and it terminates when all children are done, similary like the ParallelBehaviour runs, but using priorities.

The priorities of the children are represented by a number greater or equal than zero. The lesser is this number, the higher is the priority of the behaviour. The priorities are incrememented during time to avoid its starvation. The exception is when there is any behaviour with a priority 0, in which in this case this increment is stopped.

When a behaviour either has or reaches priority 0 is inserted in a list of ready behaviours.

Roughly speaking, the scheduler runs as follows:

  1. If there are no child behaviours then this CompositeBehaviour is done.
  2. If there are not any runnable behaviour (i.e., all the children is blocked), then block this behaviour.
  3. While there are behaviours in the ready behaviours list, picks the first one, and if it is runnable then execute it. Drop it from this list.
  4. If the ready behaviours list is empty, then searches all behaviours, either blocked or not, with priority 0 and insert they in the ready behaviours list. Resets its priority.
  5. If the ready behaviours list is empty, and there is not any behaviour with priority 0, then renices all behaviours. That is, searches for the behaviour with the lesser priority number, and increment all the priorities by this number (i.e., rests to the priority number this number). Go to step 4.
  6. Go to the step 1.

Constructor Detail

ParallelPriorityBehaviour

public ParallelPriorityBehaviour()
Default constructor. Creates a CompositeBehaviour without setting the owner agent, and executes its children in a priority-based manner, and it terminates when all children are done.

ParallelPriorityBehaviour

public ParallelPriorityBehaviour(int endCondition)
Constructs a ParallelPriorityBehaviour without setting the owner agent.

Parameters:
endCondition - This value defines the termination condition for this ParallelPriorityBehaviour. Use
  • WHEN_ALL to terminate this ParallelPriorityBehaviour when all its children are done.
  • WHEN_ANY to terminate this ParallelPriorityBehaviour when any of its child is done.
  • a positive int value n to terminate this ParallelPriorityBehaviour when n of its children are done.

ParallelPriorityBehaviour

public ParallelPriorityBehaviour(jade.core.Agent a)
Creates a ParallelPriorityBehaviour setting the owner agent. This behaviour terminates when all children are done.

Parameters:
a - the agent owning this behaviour

ParallelPriorityBehaviour

public ParallelPriorityBehaviour(jade.core.Agent a,
                                 int endCondition)
Constructs a ParallelPriorityBehaviour setting the owner agent.

Parameters:
a - the agent owning this behaviour
endCondition - This value defines the termination condition for this ParallelPriorityBehaviour. Use
  • WHEN_ALL to terminate this ParallelPriorityBehaviour when all its children are done.
  • WHEN_ANY to terminate this ParallelPriorityBehaviour when any of its child is done.
  • a positive int value n to terminate this ParallelPriorityBehaviour when n of its children are done.

addSubBehaviour

public void addSubBehaviour(jade.core.behaviours.Behaviour b,
                            int priority)
Adds a priority behaviour to this ParallelPriorityBehaviour.

Parameters:
b - the behaviour to be added
priority - the priority of the behaviour. If it is less than 0 then it is changed to 0.

changePriority

public void changePriority(jade.core.behaviours.Behaviour b,
                           int newPriority,
                           boolean changeNow)
Changes the priority of a behaviour.

Parameters:
b - the behaviour which priority is to be changed
newPriority - the new priority of the behaviour. If it less than 0 then uses 0.
changeNow - true if the change must be reflected inmediately, that is, the dynamic priority is reset to the new static priority, or false if this change takes effect after the execution of the behaviour
